intro: Botrycarpum nigrum, commonly known as black thimbleweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found in open woodlands or along stream banks. Its fruit, known as a schizocarp, splits into two parts when mature, each containing a single seed. Botrycarpum nigrum is often overlooked due to its unassuming appearance but plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects.
